Sheets Developer Tool

Sheets is a developer report generator that performs deep analysis on codebases and URLs using AI. It's built entirely on Cloudflare's platform and uses OpenRouter with moonshotai/kimi-k2 for intelligent analysis.

Features

  • Deep codebase analysis for any URL
  • Special GitHub repository analysis
  • Context-aware reports using your developer standards
  • Interactive file tagging with # syntax
  • Streaming responses for long-running analysis

Getting Started

1. Upload Your Context

Visit the Rules page to upload your developer context files. These can include:

  • Coding standards and style guides
  • Architecture documentation
  • Best practices and patterns
  • Project-specific requirements

2. Generate Reports

On the main page, enter a prompt that includes at least one URL. Examples:

Analyze https://github.com/user/repo and suggest improvements based on #standards/react.md

Review this codebase for security issues: https://example.com/repo

Extract useful patterns from https://github.com/popular/library #architecture/microservices.md

3. Use File Tags

Reference your context files using the # syntax:

  • Type # to see all available files
  • Continue typing to filter results
  • Click or press Enter to complete the tag

API Integration

Sheets uses OpenRouter with the moonshotai/kimi-k2 model for analysis. To deploy your own instance:

  1. Get an API key from OpenRouter
  2. Create a Cloudflare KV namespace
  3. Update wrangler.toml with your credentials
  4. Deploy using: npm run deploy-worker && npm run deploy-pages

Keyboard Shortcuts

  • Ctrl + Enter - Generate report
  • # - Trigger file autocomplete
  • Esc - Close file editor

Tips

  • For GitHub repos, the tool automatically fetches README and file contents
  • Upload comprehensive context files for better analysis
  • Use specific prompts for targeted analysis
  • Reports are streamed in real-time - longer analysis provides more detail

Open Source

Sheets is open source. View the code and contribute on GitHub.
